comments: Generates distinct values, the first 61 of which, n=[0,60], are primes.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: lst={};Do[p=4*n^2-152*n+1487+(6*n-114)*(-1)^n;If[PrimeQ[p],AppendTo[lst,p]],{n,0,5!}];lst [_Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 28 2009]Select[Table[4n^2-152n+1487+(6n-114)(-1)^n,{n,0,50}],PrimeQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 15 2011 *)
author: _Tito Piezas III_, May 11 2001
